meanings.definition: The act of making a hole or tunnel by boring.
meanings.sent1: The borings in the ground were evidence of the construction work.
meanings.sent2: The miners examined the borings to determine the depth of the tunnel.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse made borings in the cheese to create a cozy home.
meanings.sent4: The borings of the woodpecker echoed through the quiet forest.
meanings.sent5: The borings of the drill left a trail of dust behind.

meanings.definition: A hole or tunnel made by boring.
meanings.sent1: The borings in the wall allowed the insects to enter the house.
meanings.sent2: The engineer inspected the borings to ensure stability of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant colony thrived in the borings of the old tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The borings in the mountain served as a secret passage for the rebels.
meanings.sent5: The borings of the mole created a network of underground tunnels.

meanings.sent1: The lecture was so borings that many students fell asleep.
meanings.sent2: The borings movie failed to capture the audience's attention.
meanings.sent3: Even the most exciting topic can become borings if presented poorly.
meanings.sent4: The borings gray sky seemed to stretch on forever.
